ej,bradm001,P,nelsj901,Called third strike from bench ej,washr001,M,nelsj901,Arguing about Milton Bradley's ejection Rangers designated hitter Milton Bradley ejected by HP umpire Jeff Nelson for yelling from the bench after being called out on strikes; Rangers manager Ron Washington went out to discuss this with Nelson and was also ejected by Nelson

$Carlos Guillen stared at pitcher Glen Perkins after a pitch was high and inside

ej,gardr001,M,hoyej901,Arguing warning to both teams $the first pitch to Joe Mauer was behind him and the second almost hit him; HP umpire James Hoye issued a warning to both teams and Twins manager Ron Gardenhire came out to argue with Hoye, who ejected Gardenhire
Debut game for Taylor Teagarden

ej,gardr001,M,fostm901,Checked swing $on the third pitch to Denard Span, he was struck by the pitch and awarded first by HP umpire Bill Welke; Span had attempted to bunt and 3B umpire Marty Foster ruled that Span had swung; thus, Span had to come back to the plate and resume his at bat; Twins Manager Ron Gardenhire came out to argue with Foster and was ejected by Foster; Gardenhire argued for several minutes; as he left the field, Gardenhire threw his hat and kicked it about 15 feet into the air; the crowd chanted 'Gardy!, Gardy!' and started throwing hats and other items onto the field; White Sox Manager Ozzie Guillen took his team off the field; Gardenhire said after the game that the hat was excessive but that he hoped the Vikings coach saw it in case he needs a new punter; said Gardenhire: 'I got good height on it!'
Debut game for Randy Ruiz
Twins Manager Ron Gardenhire served a one-game suspension for his outburst on July 31; 3B Coach Scott Ulger was the acting manager
$Brendan Harris called for interference
Yankees pitcher Dan Giese left the game due to an injured neck/shoulder

umpchange,6,umphome,campa902 umpchange,6,ump1b,rungb901 umpchange,6,ump2b,(None) $Buscher fouled off the third pitch, which struck HP umpire Mike Winters on the mask; after a delay, Winters left the game and 1B umpire Angel Campos moved behind the plate

ej,riggj801,M,wegnm901,Catch/no catch call $Suzuki dropped the ball apparently while transfering it from his glove to his throwing hand and 1B umpire Mark Wegner ruled it was not a catch; Mariners Manager Jim Riggleman ejected by Wegner for arguing the call
